page.title: 04A stranger visits Grindon
page.content: June 20th, 1985. We went to Grindon and parked near a church which had a graveyard. The church was quite old. It had gates in front. It was called All Saints and was rebuilt about 100 years ago by Samuel Bradshaw at a cost of 4000 pounds. We went further down the road and we walked past a house and some puppies started to follow us. We went past the Cavalier pub which has got new owners. Next we interviewed the postlady and we asked her questions. After we had finished interviewing we went up the road and we met the two puppies again and we saw an old school which was used for playschool and the Parish Council's meetings. The playground had a swing and a seesaw - and the puppies were still following us!
